dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Table six is up! -- and turns away, back to the grill. A HAND reaches in, takes the plates, and sets them on a t the tray, but see only the right arm and aproned midsecti carrying it. He carries the tray along the counter toward swinging doors that lead out into the restaurant. The doors swing in as another WAITER sweeps into the kitc waiter heads out into the dining area. As the doors swing him, they reveal storage shelves crammed with bags of ric tomatoes -- -- and a DEAD WAITER, literally folded in half and stuffe shelves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSENBERG and the ARQUILLIAN raise their glasses in a toa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the continued reign of the Arquillian Empire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the safety of the galaxy. They CLINK glasses and drink, just as the Waiter arrives. only his arms and midsection as he sets the tray on a sta plates of pirogi. He carries them to the table and sets t Rosenberg, setting his glass down next to the plate, catc the Waiter's hand -- -- just as an enormous silverfish bug slithers out of the and scurries across the table. The glass slips out of Ros dumping wine all over the table. He looks up, slowly, and sees the Waiter's face. It's EDGAR. Another half dozen insects of all variety tum Edgar's sleeves and scurry across the table. Rosenberg an freeze, paralyzed with fear. They seem to know what dire Edgar's presence holds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can kill us both -- but you will not find it. Edgar smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right about one thing. Suddenly a long STINGER whips out from under the back of zips under the table. First Rosenberg and then the Arquil forward their chairs, their faces contorting in pain. They both pitch forward, their faces slogging into fresh The stinger SNAPS out from under the table and whips back apron. He moves quickly, searching their pockets, but he he's looking for. The cat, still perched on top of the or at him. Edgar reaches out and BATS the cat away with one vicious hand. The animal HOWLS and flies across the room, landing lunch. The Woman SCREAMS. Now other DINERS' attention is drawn t where two obviously dead men are being robbed by a waiter SHOUTS of outrage, a few MEN rise out of their seats. Edgar grabs the ornate box and tries to open it, but find the furor rising around him, he shoves the box under one the door. Rosenberg's cat leaps back onto the table and SNARLS at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later, and the Russian diner is now a crime scene, cluste flashing lights. THREE BODIES, now on stretchers and cove are being loaded into the back of ambulances. ROSENBERG'S CAT races out of a UNIFORMED COP's arms and l the stretchers, MEOWING mournfully. The Uniformed Cop tur INSPECTOR who is questioning the WOMAN from the diner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do with the cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Send it with the stiff. Let family claim it. The Cop nods and follows the stretcher with Rosenberg's b of one of the ambulances, allowing the cat to ride on the dead owner for the time being. The doors of the wagon SLAM shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stretcher with the corpse on it is wheeled down a cor headquarters. ROSENBERG'S CAT, still on his chest, MEOWS stretcher approaches two doors with "City Morgue" written words split in half as the stretcher BANGS through the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city morgue is a crowded, brightly-lit, tiled place w parked left and right. Busy day in the Apple. The Cop whe stretcher calls out to the CORONER, who's hunched over an

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want contestant number three? The coroner turns around. It's DR. LAUREL WEAVER, the wom speak to Jay before. She sighs and waves a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the wall, I guess. (noticing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, the cat. There's a problem with the cat. Sign here. Laurel signs his clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the problem with the cat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your problem. Laurel gives him a dirty look, but he laughs and leaves. the stretcher and bends down, petting Rosenberg's cat gen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having a bad day, baby?  Cheer up. (of Rosenberg)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His is worse. She sets the cat aside and wheels the stretcher under the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okey-dokey. Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Kay's LTD SCREECHES to a halt in front of the kiosk on Or and KAY leap out and Jay spots the VENDOR, closing up the wearing a dirty cardigan, watch cap, and fingerless glove aquiver with ticks and mannerisms. He has a small dog in Jay rolls his eyes as they step up to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course that guy's an alien. That's gotta be the worst disguise I've ever seen. A voice answers him, but not the Vendor's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't like it, you can kiss my furry little butt. Jay looks down. The voice is coming from the dog. This is Kay approaches, motioning to Jay to make sure no one hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You busy, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kay, I can't talk right now, my ride's leaving in -- Kay grabs Frank. He yelps like, well, a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call the pound. We got a stray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Get your paws off me! PASSERBYS glare at Kay, who appears to be seriously mistr little dog. Jay tries to explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The, uh...dog owes my friend some money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arquillians and bugs. What do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a thing? Kay shakes Frank the Pug, trying to force an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it. Okay, okay. Rosenberg wasn't some two-bit Arquillian. He was the guardian of a galaxy. They thought he would be safe here on earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bug had other plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The galaxy is the best source for subatomic energy in the universe. If the bugs get their slimy claws on it, kiss the Arquillians goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him about the belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosenberg said something about a galaxy on "Orion's belt." What's he talking about, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats me. Kay shakes Frank the Pug once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a person passing by)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're rehearsing a ventriloquist act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The galaxy is here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The galaxy is hundreds of millions of stars and planets? How's it here? If a dog can smirk, Frank does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You humans, when're you gonna learn that size doesn't matter? Just 'cause something's important, doesn't mean it's not very, very small.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How small?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiny. Like the size of a marble. Or a jewel. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to be walked before the flight. Kay lets go of Frank, turns to Jay, who is lost in though

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank the Pug)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here. (then to Jay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The galaxy's here. It's not on Orion's belt. Jay suddenly notices Frank the Pug bark at a cat farther sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the morgue, LAUREL is working at a desk when suddenly leaps up onto it from nowhere, the way cats do, landing r middle of the file she's studying. Laurel jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, when you want attention -- She pets the cat. As she does, the cat's collar shines in Laurel turns the name tag to face her.

dialogues.speaker: A PRECIOUS JEWEL, AND THE WORD "ORION."
dialogues.text: As it is written across the collar of the cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Orion." That's a pretty name. From out in the corridor, a bell rings -- DING, DING. Laurel notices something dangling from the cat's collar - of a strange and beautiful metal. The center is some sort translucent material, light green in color.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this? She peers into the jewel, and her face washes over with a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as if Laurel is sucked into another universe. Her fa beatifically blank as she sails through a massive starfie stars, billions of green, verdant planets, all racing by of light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Outside, the bell DINGS again. Orion looks up, as if know there, and not liking it. She SNARLS at the door and leap scurrying across the lab and disappearing under some equi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay barrel through town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So two galaxies have been fighting for years. And the only people who've been benefiting are a race of creatures called bugs. Then the two galaxies decide to make peace...and the bugs send this guy down to make sure the fighting never stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By killing the emissaries, and stealing the galaxy they've been fighting about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we don't get it back before he leaves the planet...we're history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not even history. 'Cause history implies there's someone around to remember it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a counter in the morgue corridor, a gray, peeling hand on a countertop, over and over. The hand belongs to EDGAR his shotgun, concealing it behind one leg. The morgue att emerges from a small security cage carrying a worn paperb Shrugged and a fly swatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for making sure the bell works. Suddenly, quick as a gunfighter, Tony SNAPS the fly swatt BUZZING FLY. Edgar winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edgar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, Farmer John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man came in here earlier. A dead man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this means what to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a very dear friend of mine. And I believe he had an animal with him. A gift I gave him, a pet cat that means worlds to me. I would like it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need a picture ID, written proof of ownership of the cat, or notarized proof of kinship with -- WHACK! Tony flicks the fly swatter again, sending another maker. Edgar grits his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the deceased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't -- do that. WHACK! Still another fly goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what? Tony looks down, to where Edgar's hands rest on the count cockroaches stream out of his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! He ducks under the counter -- -- and comes up with a can of Raid. Edgar's eyes bug out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay's LTD pulls to a stop in front of the morgue and JAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll handle this one, you wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because all we have to do is walk in and get a cat, it's not that hard. But if you go in, you're gonna lay your Jack Webb on her and flash your brain ray in her face and she's gonna end up with leukemia or some shit. The woman's a doctor, she doesn't need you erasing half her med school classes. Take me five minutes. And he continues into the morgue, leaving Kay waiting out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAUREL SLAMS into a wall on one side of the morgue, throw He leans in, close, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the animal?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I don't know, it ran under some equipment! Over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it! He grabs her roughly and drags her across the morgue, tow she pointed to. As they draw close, ORION the cat bolts f it, races between their legs, and leapfrogs over several landing on top of a very tall one with only six inches cl it and the ceiling. A very tough hiding place. Edgar just starts to turn when they hear the BELL and a V corridor outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Anybody here? Edgar looks up at the cat's hiding place. No time to get DINGS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Roughly, Edgar pulls Laurel close and puts a finger to hi "Shhhhhhh."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the corridor, JAY looks around. No Tony, no answer to DINGS once more, then heads into the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JAY comes into the morgue. LAUREL is in there, standing r an examination table, but there is no corpse on the table draped over it. She just stands there, in the middle of t at Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (oddly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashes a badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sergeant Friday, from the Twenty-Sixth precinct. They brought a cat in here with a corpse the other day, might have said "Orion" on the cat's name tag?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, well, the cat is, uh -- the cat's a witness in a murder case and I'm going to need to take it with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where the cat is at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (lowers her voice to a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could take me with you instead. Jay looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, maybe you could take me with you instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, you do start fast, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd really like to go with you. Now. Jay just looks at her, amazed at the power he seems to ha woman. He looks over his shoulder, to make sure he has a alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, uh, why exactly is that? Laurel rolls her eyes. She seems irritated with him, but with what she's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAY comes down the stairs and into the morgue corridor. watch, then leans against the counter and pulls out a pac Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay is thoroughly enjoying himself, but Laurel seems to b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something I need to show you. She looks down, pointedly, in the direction of her waist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now slow down, you don't have to hit the gas like that. She leans in and lowers her voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. You really need to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I will. But we gotta get something straight here -- I'm gonna drive. It's not some kind of macho trip, it's just the way I'm used to doing things, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay pulls out a box of matches and strikes one on the sid to his cigarette, but as it draws close, the match goes o SIZZLE. Kay furrows his brow. Odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laurel is at the end of her rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Stud, I don't know how many more times I'm going to get to tell you this. There's something -- She points, sharply, at the examination table directly in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- that you have to help me with. Jay's smile vanishes and his jaw drops as he figures it o reach for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay raises another lit match to his cigarette, but as thi a BIG GLOB OF GOO drops from the ceiling and onto the mat flame. Kay looks up, sharply. Above him, TONY, the counter guy, is stuck to one high co ceiling by an enormous wad of viscous, dripping fluid. He look of terror on his face and the can of Raid still clut From inside the morgue, Laurel SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay races into the morgue just as the examination table E air, revealing EDGAR, who was hiding beneath it. Now everything happens at once. Jay leaps back and draws Cricket, Kay pulls out his series four deatomizer, and Ed shotgun under Laurel's chin, using her body to shield his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze it, Bug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot! Don't shoot!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jay)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIST, are you THICK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was I supposed to know!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I have to do, SING it for you!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you didn't come on like a drunken prom date!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's SO typical. Any time a woman shows the slightest hint of sexual independence, men just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody shut UP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go, Shit Eater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Monkey Boy, I may have to take that kind of talk in my end of the universe, but compared to you humans, I'm the top rung on the evolutionary ladder, so can it, all right?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're breakin' my heart. Move six inches to your left and I'll solve all your problems. ORION the cat suddenly attacks, leaping off the top of th landing on Edgar, HISSING and scratching and clawing for Edgar snaps an arm up and whips her off. The cat squirms icon jangling. Edgar grabs the icon, holds onto it, and f away, across the morgue. The icon comes free, remaining i He drops it into his mouth and swallows. He shoves the gu Laurel's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's better. Now put down your weapons. We're leaving. Kay freezes, teeth clenched, gun still in front of him. S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever pulled the wings off a fly? Edgar cranks one of Laurel's arms behind her back, hard, in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care to see the fly get even?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far you think you'll get without your ship? If that's what you call that hunk of space crap we've got back at our office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the weapons down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never gonna happen, Insect. Edgar backs away with Laurel, further into the morgue, to window that looks out at the base of an air shaft. Jay an slowly, cornering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Laurel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOW is it okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it's going to be okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bet on it, meat sack. And with that he turns, leaps -- -- and CRASHES right through the window, into the air sha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDGAR, still clutching LAUREL, EXPLODES up over a railing Nobody looks twice as Edgar, dragging Laurel (with his ar mouth), races toward the nearby busy Manhattan Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay duck into the air shaft and look up -- too fa the walls are smooth anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! They turn and run out of the morgue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDGAR, with LAUREL, RUNS right in front of a CAB, which s halt inches from them. The CABBIE sticks his head out and in an unknown language. And KEEPS yelling as -- Edgar reaches through the passenger side and pulls the Ca (cigarette and wooden seat-beads and all). The Cab Driver is still yelling as Edgar leaps in, pushin before him, leaving her behind the wheel. He removes a POSTCARD -- the one he took from the display newsstand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take me here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What??? Edgar just cranks the car into gear -- opening his mouth the icon -- and in so doing revealing a TRIPLE ROW OF SER he SLAMS HIS FOOT on the gas pedal. Laurel's head snaps back as the car rocks forward. She ha to grab the wheel and start steering as -- The car screeches out into traffic, swerving wildly as La make a 90-degree turn. The car fishtails wildly, swiping as it straightens and heads into the traffic. The furious Cab Driver runs off after it, still yelling a around the corner. A second later, KAY and JAY rush out into the street. The to be seen. Jay runs into the street, noticing the wooden ripped pine-scented green deodorizer, and the still-burni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in a cab. And Jay starts running down the street, where DOZENS of c at the intersection.  He's running from cab to cab, pound scaring the living shit out of people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Laurel!? Hey! -- but Laurel and Edgar are nowhere to be found. Up ahead green and the tide of taxis wash away, leaving Jay on the as a car screeches up behind him, its headlights shining it gets closer, Jay sees it's Kay in the LTD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop wasting time. He's not getting off the planet in a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay and Kay rush in from the door under the World's Fair toward the main display screen; all around them, the MIB frenetic activity in response to the threat from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to tech at a desk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me. Put up a bio-net all the way around Manhattan; if it's not human, it's not leaving the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What've we got from our friends upstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same thing: "Deliver the galaxy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well the bug's got the galaxy, but we've got his ship. He's got to be looking for a way out. Just then, a loud ALARM wails. AT THE MAIN VIEWING SCREEN, A GREEN LINE shoots out from ship, striking a region of planet earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- headquarters, where every bell, whistle and light imag off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arquillian battle rules, kid. First we get an ultimatum, then a warning shot, then we have a galactic standard week to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A galactic standard week? How the hell long is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hour? Viewing the screen, it now reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DELIVER THE GALAXY OR THE EARTH WILL BE DESTROYED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To keep the bugs from getting it, the Arquillians will destroy the galaxy and whatever planet it's on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about US!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucks, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up the locations of all land-based interstellar vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all gone. Frank the Pug took the last ship on the planet. As Kay and Zed watch as the machine scrolls through the d back towards the center of the room, deep in thought. Ove

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atlantic City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That landfill on the Jersey Shore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Epcot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami Beach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fellas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hartford?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gone, thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Old guys. Kay and Zed both look up at once, scowling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do those still work? They follow his gaze, up, over the computer terminals. Th in front of them, where it has loomed for the entire movi enormous mural of the 1964 World's Fair grounds. Most pro mural are two tall towers that rise dramatically from the by -- -- the two flying saucers from the very first alien conta there, wide-eyed, staring at it, we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the real-live twin towers on the actual fairgrounds in Meadows. A taxi SCREECHES to a halt at the edge of a fenc away. EDGAR shoves LAUREL out through the driver's door a her, still holding his weapon on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Why?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a long trip. I'll need a snack. And he shoves her ahead of him, off in the direction of t Behind him, abandoned on the front seat of the cab, we fi front of the postcard he's been carrying around. "FLUSHIN OF THE 1964 WORLD'S FAIR," it says, with a distinctive ph spaceships. So that's how he knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nighttime now, and the city hums along, just another Thur clock in Columbus Circle says it's 7:45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TVs in the window of an appliance store show a rerun of " laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news ticker in Times Square announces the latest shat

dialogues.speaker: RAIN LIKELY
dialogues.text: EARTHLINGS pass left and right, blissfully unaware of the doom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAY and JAY leap into Kay's LTD and SLAM the doors. Kay j the ignition, the car ROARS to life, and he turns to Jay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya say we bag us some bug? He hits the gas and the car ROCKETS away from the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LTD tears through the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay turns sharply to the right, SMACKING Jay around. Look sees the entrance to the midtown tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking the tunnel?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know a better way to Queens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's usually jammed?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LTD races through the tunnel at top speed. It's clear few seconds, but then they round a bend -- -- and there's a traffic jam up ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kay approaches the line of cars at top speed, with no int down. Jay, terrified, holds on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay. The button?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push the button, Jay. A LIGHTED PANEL rotates into place between the two front red button flashes underneath its plastic shield again. J plastic cover and JAMS his finger down on the red flashin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you may want to throw on a seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the LTD rockets toward the traffic jam up ahead, it be its shape actually changing. The sides and back extend as endoskeleton pushes the "normal" panels out. It becomes a machine, held together by an elaborate series of mechanic metallic tendons. Kay's car hurtles toward certain death in the traffic jam possible moment it swerves off to the side, a SUCKING SOU underneath it. Instead of banging off the wall of the tunnel, the LTD ac it. It swerves up, onto the wall and hangs there, racing below. It keeps going, turning all the way over and driving upsi clinging to the roof of the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jay falls from his seat with a CLUNK, onto the upside dow car. Balled up on the back of his neck, he peers out the tear through the tunnel, ZOOMING over the bottlenecked tr As they race through the tunnel, they have a minute to ki

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if I smoke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the car, I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, just a common courtesy. It bothers some people if you smoke in a car. He lights a cigarette and blows the smoke out leisurely, wheel, just waiting out the tunnel. Jay gives up struggli himself and closes his eyes, suffering through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From outside the car, we watch it rocket along on the roo We can hear KAY'S VOICE as he goes on. And on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's harder and harder to smoke anywhere these days. Hell, I suppose I should quit. I've tried. Never took, though. I'm beginning to think I lack self-control. And they disappear out the other end of the tunnel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and flip over, BANGING back down onto the road on the falls off the ceiling and SLAMS into his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, back to work. He flips his cigarette out the window and cranks the whee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching a toll booth, the LTD shoots across nine lane through the only open booth, SHATTERING the gate. Traveli hundred miles an hour, Kay nonchalantly flips a token out -- and it CHINKS in the basket as their taillights disapp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDGAR climbs the outside of the landing tower of one of t pushing LAUREL up ahead of him, headed for the saucer at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let me go, you don't want to eat me. I'm a very important person on my planet. Like a queen. A goddess, even. There are those who worship me, yes. I'm not trying to impress you with this, I'm just letting you know. It could start a war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. War means food for my family, all seventy-eight million of them. That's a lot of mouths to feed, your highness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a wonderful dad. And with that she KICKS him squarely in the face. He reel losing his grip on her. She takes advantage of the moment HERSELF out, into the air. Edgar flails, but she is beyond his reach. She falls, tum air -- -- and lands in the branches of a tree. She hits hard, th rattling, and reaches out and hangs on for dear life, hig ground. Above, Edgar just keeps climbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over at the fence, the LTD comes to a looooong, skidding fairgrounds. AT THE TRUNK, JAY and KAY flip open the trunk and scarf u weapons look most dangerous. Kay grabs a black box, UNSNA latches, and opens it, revealing -- -- the most wicked-looking shotgun on the planet. Three feet long, triple-barreled, over and under and unde action reloader on top of a storage clip for a dozen more shells themselves are solid, glistening like polished ste the clip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

He grabs the spike with both hands and is about to thrust into the Bug's gut, when; The Bug bends its head down between its legs. BUG'S POV of Jay there, upside-down from this perspective the Bug's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking towards them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've just been down the gullet of an interstellar cockroach. That's one of a hundred memories I don't want. Jay takes the neuralyzer. Slips on his glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you around, sport. Jay raises the neuralyzer. With a brilliant FLASH, the sc

dialogues.text: Our solar system is just a few blips of light in a vast s
